Having played G:BF, here's what I know has been developed so
far.  I think I even have a level editor for G:BF that I haven't dared
to touch...

----- Original Message -----
From: dancing corpse <dancing_corpse@...>
To: <gladiator@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 03, 2001 2:07 AM
Subject: Re: [gladiator] Optimal configuration settings


> the reason i'm not writing about improvements for  G:BF are all i want
are:
> -better graffics

Already in.  The graphics are great, and I think that the people who
did the graphics in G:BF were actually scooped up by Blizzard for
work on Diablo 2.

> -changes in charecters to take affect

Not completely sure what you mean.

> -better ai

Somewhat improved, and from a single player's perspective (though
my friend Lonny and I used to spend all night playing Gladiator to its
bitter end on my 386) greatly improved.  Your team will follow the
character you're controlling.

> -ability to change victory conditiones in scenario's like tev did only
> without c++

As far as I know, this is also possible to do in SCEN.EXE that
comes with your registered gladiators package.  Things such as
no NPC death (IE, tic and tac can't die) upon completion of the
level are possible to do from this, at least I know that much.

> that's about all I need i'm happy to leave the programmers to decide
> everything else
>
> if programmer's finish up there test files soon that could bring back
> descusion. i could also start creating my scenario's. about the
tourniment:
> would you need to be part of gladlist to partake?
>

> From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>
> Reply-To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
> To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [gladiator] Optimal configuration settings
> Date: Tue, 03 Jul 2001 05:52:53 -0000
>
> Ok, this topic is restricted to those of us with modern computers.
> Just joking.
>
> When you right click on the file to run gladiator and then click on
> properties, what special modifications have you done to make the game
> run more smoothly?
>
> I have changed the following Memory settings:
> Intial Environment from Auto to 4096
> Extended Memory from Auto to 4096
>
> I have tried changing Extended Memory to higher values, but that
> always results in the game crashing.  I have also tried changing
> Conventional Memory but that results in the game crashing.  Changing
> MS-DOS protected mode memory has also resulted in the game crashing.
>
> Are there any other modifications I can do to increase Gladiator's
> performance?  I have already closed down almost all my other programs
> when running gladiator.
>
> BTW, after this topic, there are no new topics avaiable.
>
>
